info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Iberia, St. Mary and southeastern St. Martin Parishes through 400 PM CDT... At 302 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Geismar to 6 miles southeast of Cote Blanche Island. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Iberia, Morgan City, Franklin, Patterson, Jeanerette, Berwick, Burns Point, Belle River, Bayou Vista, Cypremort Point, Stephensville, Avery Island, Baldwin, Ellerslie, Patterson Memorial Airport, Lydia, Sorrel, Amelia, Bayou Geneve and Glencoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
